metadata.case_name: Appellant (son of Ittiyavira) v. Respondents (purchasers from Venkiteswara Iyer)

facts.text: 23 items of property originally belonged to Ramalinga Iyer and Raman Velayudhan.

Ramalinga Iyer and Raman Velayudhan sold the properties on 6-6-1080 Malayalam Era (roughly 1905) to Ittiyavira, father of appellant-defendant No. 1. Part consideration paid in cash, balance secured by two hypothecation bonds executed by Ittiyavira on same date.
One hypothecation bond for Rs. 308-8-0 in favour of Raman Velayudhan, hypothecating items 3,5,14,18.
Other hypothecation bond for Rs. 2,191-8-0 in favour of Ramalinga Iyer, hypothecating items 1,2,4,6-13,15-17,19-23 and remaining items subject to prior hypothecation.
On 3-1-1082, Ramalinga Iyer assigned his hypothecation bond to Sankara Rama Iyer via Ex. V (disputed as sham by respondents).
Ramalinga Iyer executed promissory note in favour of Anantha Iyer. After Ramalinga Iyer's death, Anantha Iyer sued his son Sankara Subha Iyer, obtained decree Ex. VI on 13-11-1088.
Treating Ex. V as sham, Anantha Iyer attached and purchased at court auction Ramalinga Iyer's mortgagee rights in hypothecation bond.
In partition in Anantha Iyer's family, rights under hypothecation bond allotted to Anantha Iyer and brother Manicka Iyer.
Anantha Iyer and Manicka Iyer instituted O.S. No. 59 of 1093 against Ittiyavira, obtained decree for realisation.
Decree-holders transferred decree to Venkiteswara Iyer, who executed it and purchased hypothecated properties at court auction on 27-4-1099 (Ex. C sale certificate), obtained possession on 12-7-1099.

Raman Velayudhan assigned his hypothecation bond; decree obtained in O.S. No. 462 of 1094, items 3,5,14,18 purchased by Mathai Ouseph (brother of defendant No. 2) on 10-11-1096, possession on 19-6-1098, sold to defendant No. 2 on 5-12-1104.
Ittiyavira executed sale deed Ex. XXIX to appellant (his son) on 8-10-1092 conveying all suit properties (disputed as sham by respondents).
Appellant not made party to O.S. No. 59 of 1093.
On 2-2-1108, Venkiteswara Iyer sold suit properties to plaintiffs-respondents.
Respondents instituted s.145 CrPC proceedings; Magistrate held appellant in possession on 28-12-1111, affirmed by High Court; possession handed to appellant.

Respondents' suit (O.S. No. 721 of 1951 appeal) instituted originally as O.S. No. 1296 of 1114 in Munsiff Moovattupuzha, plaint returned on 21-2-1118 for presentation to District Court Parur due to valuation Rs.4,602, re-presented 4-3-1118.
Trial court (District Court Parur) dismissed suit; High Court Travancore-Cochin reversed except items 3,5,14,18 (no cross-appeal).

legal_issues.text: Whether decree in O.S. No. 59 of 1093 was nullity as barred by time.
Whether suit barred by limitation under Art. 47 or Art. 142 Limitation Act.
Whether actual delivery of possession effected to auction-purchaser Venkiteswara Iyer on 12-7-1099.
Whether assignment Ex. V of hypothecation bond by Ramalinga Iyer to Sankara Rama Iyer was genuine.
Whether sale deed Ex. XXIX by Ittiyavira to appellant was genuine, making appellant necessary party to O.S. No. 59/1093.
Whether High Court appeal rightly heard by Division Bench of two judges.

petitioner_arguments.text: Decree in O.S. 59/1093 nullity as suit barred by time.
Suit barred by 3 years from Magistrate's s.145 order.
Suit barred under Art.142 as respondents not in possession within 12 years; delivery of possession to Venkiteswara sham.
Ex. V assignment genuine, so Anantha Iyer got no rights.
Ex. XXIX sale genuine, appellant not bound by O.S.59/1093 decree as not party.
High Court appeal should have been by 3-judge bench.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Travancore High Court Act 1099 s.11(1), Act V of 1125 s.25

respondent_arguments.text: Ex. XXIX sham transaction; appellant not necessary party to O.S.59/1093.
Suit within time due to s.14 Limitation Act exclusion for plaint return.

court_reasoning.text: Even if O.S.59/1093 barred by time, decree not nullity; court with jurisdiction deciding wrong not acting without jurisdiction; error correctable only by appeal.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Courts have jurisdiction to decide right or wrong; erroneous decree not nullity.

court_reasoning.text: Limitation plea not properly raised; no clear plea in written statement; suit within time when filed in Munsiff court, s.14 applies; point mixed fact/law, no leave to raise in SC.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Appellant waived plea; plaint returned under s.14.

court_reasoning.text: Actual delivery of possession to Venkiteswara on 12-7-1099 proved by Ex.D, PW2, PW3; presumption of regularity; appellant's Ex.J claims right not obstruction; s.145 possession post-trespass; receiver possession benefits true owner.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Actual possession delivered; suit for eviction of trespasser.

court_reasoning.text: Ex.V sham: Ramalinga in debt, took back document, no evidence of consideration/acceptance/handover, no enforcement for 32 years.
Ex.XXIX sham: father-son, no independent means, suspicious recitals, no proof payments, appellant's inconsistent statements, continued ownership by father, possession as agent.
Appeal rights governed by law at appeal time; new High Court post-merger; no vested right to specific bench size; procedural matter.

holdings.text: Decree in O.S.59/1093 not nullity even if time-barred.
Actual delivery of possession on 12-7-1099; suit for eviction.
Ex.V sham; auction sale conveyed full rights.
Ex.XXIX sham; appellant not bona fide purchaser.
Division Bench of two judges competent.

precedents_cited.case_name: Maqbul Ahmed v. Onkar Pratap Narain
precedents_cited.relevance: s.3 Limitation Act peremptory but failure is error of law, not lack of jurisdiction; decree not nullity.

statutes_cited.name: Limitation Act
statutes_cited.relevance: Court must notice limitation; exclusion for wrong court; computation from s.145 order; adverse possession.

statutes_cited.name: Code of Criminal Procedure
statutes_cited.relevance: Proceedings for possession; finding of possession at preliminary order date.

outcome.summary: Supreme Court dismissed the appeal, upholding High Court decree in favour of respondents for remaining items (except 3,5,14,18), finding all petitioner contentions without merit: decrees valid, documents sham, suit within time, proper bench.
outcome.relief_granted: Respondents' title and possession confirmed for relevant items.

key_quotes.text: "courts have jurisdiction to decide right or to decide wrong and even though they decide wrong, the decrees rendered by them cannot be treated as nullities."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core holding on jurisdiction vs. error in limitation.

key_quotes.text: "That one circumstance, that the assignee has not made any attempt to realise the amount under the hypothecation bond during the 32 years... amounts almost to proof positive of the fact that the assignment was not a genuine transaction."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "No party has a vested right to have his appeal heard by a specified number of judges."
key_quotes.speaker: court
